entities.description: National Survey on Drug Use and Health
A measure indicating the likelihood that the difference observed would occur due to random variability.
The probability level of the test statistic, indicating the significance of observed differences.
Test statistic for comparing prevalence estimates.
An estimate of a certain condition or behavior in a population.
The estimated variance of each prevalence estimate.
The estimated covariance between two prevalence estimates.
The hypothesis stating no difference between prevalence estimates.
The hypothesis stating there is a difference in prevalence estimates.
A statistical test comparing the difference between proportions expressed as Z.
Subsections of the general population used for comparing prevalence estimates.
A statistical software package used to compute estimates of Z and associated p values.
A statistical test of independence for comparing subgroups of population and prevalence variables.

relationships.description: Indicates the significance of observed differences using a p value.
Reports an estimate of a certain condition or behavior in the surveyed population.
Defines the estimated variance for a prevalence estimate.
Defines the estimated covariance between two prevalence estimates.
Compares null hypothesis using Z statistic to determine if there is no difference between prevalence estimates.
Compares alternative hypothesis using Z statistic to determine if there is a difference in prevalence estimates.
Employs SUDAAN software package to compute Z and associated p values.
Categorizes prevalence estimates based on specific population subgroups.
Applies log-linear chi-square test for comparing population subgroups and prevalence variables.
